New Records: Sri Lanka record their lowest T20 total - 77
South Africa become the third team after England and New Zealand to bowl 70 dot balls in a T20 World Cup innings.
Ottneil Baartman became the first South Africa bowler to pick a wicket of his first delivery on T20 WC debut.
Anrich Nortje records the most economical four-over spell by a pacer in T20 World Cup (4-0-8-4).
Nortje also joins Shakib Al Hasan and Saeed Ajmal for the joint-most four-wicket hauls in T20 WCs.
Key Match Events: Charith Asalanka c Hendricks b Nortje 6 (9b)
Kusal Mendis c Stubbs b Nortje 19 (30b 1x4)
Wanindu Hasaranga st de Kock b Maharaj 0 (2b 0x4); Sadeera Samarawickrama b Maharaj 0 (1b)
Kamindu Mendis c Hendricks b Nortje 11 (15b 1x4)
Rabada to Mathews, OUT! Straight to fine leg.
Nortje to Asalanka, OUT! Straight to deep square!
Pre-Game Insights: South Africa Predicted XI: Quinton de Kock (wk), Reeza Hendricks, Aiden Markram (c), Heinrich Klaasen, David Miller, Tristan Stubbs, Marco Jansen, Keshav Maharaj, Bjorn Fortuin, Kagiso Rabada, Anrich Nortje

Sri Lanka Predicted XI: Pathum Nissanka, Kusal Mendis (wk), Kamindu Mendis, Sadeera Samarawickrama, Charith Asalanka, Angelo Mathews, Wanindu Hasaranga (c), Dasun Shanaka, Maheesh Theekshana, Dushmantha Chameera, Matheesha Pathirana
South Africa will take on Sri Lanka on Monday.
Tristan Stubbs, who has had an excellent IPL season with the Delhi Capitals will be the key player for South Africa.
Sri Lanka captain Wanindu Hasaranga will be in the spotlight.
Post-Match Reflections: Happy with the win. The batting was little up and down, probably speaks to quite a tough wicket and luckily we found ways to score on this.
Our batters tried for 160-170. To be honest this was a 120 wicket especially with our bowlers.
Definitely, this will get some momentum going. Tough few days, we've worked hard and it's nice to get some momentum.
We're going to bat first. We can see it's a good wicket. Just want to get a good score.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The outfield at the venue has come under the scanner for its softness.
The teams have also been offered an alternate training venue.
According to AccuWeather, there is a 40% chance of rainfall on the match day.
Temperatures are expected to hover around 28 degrees Celsius.
The ICC have announced a record-breaking prize fund of $11.25 million USD for the Menâ€™s T20 World Cup 2024, with the winners set to receive at least $2.45 million.
Others: Nortje's recent T20 returns do not make for fine reading and South Africa will have reasons to be worried about.
The Proteas pace attack revolves around Rabada, Nortje and Jansen and the right-arm quick's return from injury has not been ideal thus far.
